headline: Carvana and CarMax stock falls after Ford partners with Amazon
summary: Investing.com -- Carvana (NYSE:CVNA) stock fell 2.6% and CarMax (NYSE:KMX) stock dropped 1.7% on Monday after Ford Motor (NYSE:F) announced a partnership with Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) to sell certified used vehicles through the e-commerce giant’s platform.

content.title: Carvana and CarMax stock falls after Ford partners with Amazon
content.summary: Investing.com -- Carvana (NYSE:CVNA) stock fell 2.6% and CarMax (NYSE:KMX) stock dropped 1.7% on Monday after Ford Motor (NYSE:F) announced a partnership with Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) to sell certified used vehicles through the e-commerce giant’s platform.

headline: Ford Taps Amazon to Let Shoppers Buy Its Used Cars Online
summary: Ford joins Hyundai Motor Co. on the Amazon Autos portal, which allows car buyers to browse, finance and purchase a used car by clicking on the familiar “add to cart” icon.  Hyundai began selling new cars through the platform late last year, but Ford is only offering its “Blue Advantage” certified used cars on the site, the second-largest US automaker said Monday in a statement.  Car buyers will take delivery of their vehicles through Ford dealers participating in the program.

Car buyers will take delivery of their vehicles through Ford dealers participating in the program.

headline: Amazon, Ford Partner on Used Cars. 4 Stocks That Could Be Impacted.
summary: Amazon  com, with its penchant for disrupting retail industries, is going after the used car business with the help of  Ford Motor  That could be bad news for  CarGurus Cars.com CarMax  and  Carvana  though they weren’t really acting like it, for the most part.  Monday, Ford Motor and Amazon announced that car buyers can shop for certified preowned Ford vehicles on Amazon Autos.  Amazon launched its car buying platform in late 2024, partnering with  Hyundai Motor  Hertz was Amazon Autos’ first fleet customer.
